snippet: The appointment of Richard Cordray means the agency will have a strong pro-consumer leader and can now exercise its full powers.
abstract: Editorial lauds Pres Obama's recess appointment of Richard Cordray to head the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, move that has riled Congressional Republicans; contends appointment is a welcome example of Obama circumventing Republican obstructionism that has hurt the United States economy and put consumers at risk.
lead_paragraph: The appointment of Richard Cordray means the agency will have a strong pro-consumer leader and can now exercise its full powers.

headline.seo: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Gets a Chief
headline.main: The Consumer Bureau Gets a Chief
headline.print_headline: The Consumer Bureau Gets a Chief
